Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.1: A PRAYER OF HABACUC THE PROPHET <u>FOR IGNORANCES</u>.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.2: O Lord, I have heard <u>thy hearing</u>, and was afraid. O Lord, <u>thy work</u>, in the midst of the years bring it to life: In the midst of the years thou shalt make it known: when thou art angry, thou wilt remember mercy.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.3: <u>God will come from the south</u>, and the holy one from mount Pharan: His glory covered the heavens, and the earth is full of his praise.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.4: His brightness shall be as the light; <u>horns</u> are in his hands: There is his strength hid:
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.5: <u>Death shall go before his face</u>. And the devil shall go forth before his feet.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.6: He stood and measured the earth. <u>He beheld</u>, and melted the nations: and <u>the ancient mountains</u> were crushed to pieces. The hills of the world were bowed down by the journeys of his eternity.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.7: I saw the tents of <u>Ethiopia</u> for their iniquity, the curtains of the land of Madian shall be troubled.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.8: Wast thou angry, O Lord, <u>with the rivers</u>? or was thy wrath upon the rivers? or thy indignation in the sea? Who will ride upon thy horses: and thy chariots are salvation.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.9: Thou wilt surely take up thy bow: according to the oaths which thou hast spoken to the tribes. Thou wilt divide the rivers of the earth.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.10: The mountains saw thee, and were grieved: the great body of waters passed away. The deep put forth its voice: the deep lifted up its hands.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.11: The sun and the moon stood still in their habitation, in the light of thy arrows, they shall go in the brightness of thy glittering spear.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.12: In thy anger thou wilt tread the earth under foot: in thy wrath thou wilt astonish the nations.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.13: Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people: for salvation with thy Christ. Thou struckest <u>the head of the house of the wicked</u>: thou hast laid bare his foundation even to the neck.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.14: Thou hast cursed his sceptres, the head of his warriors, them that came out as a whirlwind to scatter me. Their joy was like that of him that devoureth the poor man in secret.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.15: <u>Thou madest a way in the sea</u> for thy horses, in the mud of many waters.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.16: <u>I have heard</u> and my bowels were troubled: my lips trembled at the voice. Let rottenness enter into my bones, and swarm under me. That I may rest in the day of tribulation: <u>that I may go up to our people</u> that are girded.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.17: For the fig tree shall not blossom: and there shall be no spring in the vines. The labour of the olive tree shall fail: and the fields shall yield no food: the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there shall be no herd in the stalls.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.18: But I will rejoice in the Lord: and I will joy in God my Jesus.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__03.19: The Lord God is my strength: and he will make my feet like the feet of harts: and he the conqueror will lead me upon my high places singing psalms.
